page.title: 04GROWTH OF A LOCAL FIRM
page.content: Ivon Conroy lives above Jackson Bridge .In 1967 Conroy and Booth Ltd. was formed by Mr.Conroy and his late uncle building at Ryefields, Scholes,on land owned by the family. Soon this grew into an estate.Other local building followed before they expanded to other parts of Yorkshire. By 1985 over 1000 homes had been built. Now C&B employ almost 150 people and have an annual turnover of over Â£5 million. He specialises in stonebuilt high specification houses.It takes about 3 months to build an average house costing Â£70,000. Mr.Conroy is successful because he builds desirable houses, is easy to deal with, is well organised and keeps to his promises. Unfortunately he may move operations to the more profitable Harrogate and Leeds area.
